p: Pesticides, food preservatives and antibiotics have been generally used with the aim of fighting the pathogenic microorganisms that cause foodborne outbreaks. Occasionally, they have been used indiscriminately, generating an even greater problem, i.e., antimicrobial resistance [ 2, 3]. In this context, the development of new alternatives is necessary to solve this increasing problem of public health. With this aim, numerous studies have focused on the potential use of natural compounds due to the problems derived from common preservatives and their rejection by consumers [ 4, 5, 6].
